item.title: Python & R & Reticulation, Oh My!
item.description: Python is one of the most commonly used coding languages within the modern era of computer science and statistical analysis. It is easy to use, efficient, and possesses a wide range of customization for the user to explore. For example, the package NumPyprovides methods to manipulate arrays and matrices mathematically. import numpy as np #load the library NumPy and store as `np` x = np.array([[2,4],[6,8]]) # `np.array` is a specific method within the `np` package that creates an array x ## array([[2, 4], ## [6, 8]]) print(np.

item.title: Project 2: Modeling, Testing, and Predicting
item.description: Modeling Introduction 0. (5 pts) I decided to expand upon what I worked on in Project 1 - which measured the relationship between education and crime - by focusing on a dataset that also relates to crime rates within the United States. For this project, I will be analyzing the Guns dataset from the AER library which looks at various variables related to crime rate, such as violent crime rate (violent), murder rate (murder), robbery rate (robbery), and incarceration rate (prisoners).

item.title: Project 1: Exploratory Data Analysis
item.description: Brandon Do (bmd2482) Data Wrangling and Data Exploration Rubric Prerequisite: Finding appropriate data from at least two sources per the instructions above: Failure to do this will result in a 0! You will submit a .Rmd file and a knitted document (html/pdf). 0. Introduction (4 pts) Having a good education has always been something my parents have prioritized for me. They both grew up in Vietnam in poor conditions and did not have the resources or opportunities to pursue higher educations like I fortunately have, so I wanted to tie this project with education in someway.
